detaileddescription.para: Accepted false values (case-insensitive): "0", "false", "no", "off". Any other non-empty value is treated as true.

parameterdescription.para: Value used when the variable is unset/empty.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, int def, int min_v, int max_v)
memberdef.name: env_int_get

briefdescription.para: Read an integer environment variable with clamping.

detaileddescription.para: If the variable is unset/empty or unparsable, def is returned. Otherwise, the parsed value is clamped to [min_v, max_v].

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, size_t def, size_t min_v, size_t max_v)
memberdef.name: env_sizet_get

briefdescription.para: Read a size_t environment variable with clamping.

detaileddescription.para: If the variable is unset/empty or unparsable, def is returned. Otherwise, the parsed value is clamped to [min_v, max_v].

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno-like value on failure.

briefdescription.para: Decide whether a blob should be replicated per socket.
Compute how many replicas to create under this policy.
NUMA-aware policy initialization and helper decisions.

detaileddescription.para:
This module provides a small policy object used by NUMA-aware subsystems. It:
obtains socket count via ie_topology when available,
obtains NUMA node count via sysfs-based detection (no libnuma),
reads env knobs to decide whether NUMA is enabled and whether to replicate hot blobs per socket,
provides helper decisions used by the loader and hot replication logic.

Environment variables:
IE_NUMA_ENABLE (default: 1)
IE_NUMA_REPLICATE_HOT (default: 1)
IE_NUMA_MAX_REPLICAS (default: detected_sockets, clamped to [1, 64])
IE_NUMA_HOT_MIN_BYTES (default: 33554432 = 32 MiB)
